original: NOW, THEREFORE, for good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged, the parties hereto agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
NOW, THEREFORE, in light of fair and mutually beneficial consideration, the acceptance and validity of which are duly noted, the parties involved in this agreement agree as follows:

In the event that any disputes or disagreements arise between the parties, each party shall make every reasonable effort to resolve such issues amicably and in good faith, without resorting to legal action unless absolutely necessary. If legal action becomes unavoidable, the prevailing party shall be entitled only to costs recoverable under law, and not to any attorney's fees or any additional compensation. The parties acknowledge that this agreement is entered into voluntarily and without coercion, and each party accepts personal responsibility for understanding its terms and obligations.

original: Capitalized terms contained herein shall have the meanings ascribed to them herein, or in Schedule 1  which is annexed hereto and made a part of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: The definitions assigned to capitalized terms within this Agreement are as follows: (i) those provided herein; (ii) or as set forth in the attached Schedule 1, incorporated herein by reference as an integral part of this contract. In case of any inconsistency, the meanings in Schedule 1 shall prevail.

original: 1.1. Development License . Subject to the terms and conditions set forth herein, DSS hereby grants to Developer, and Developer accepts from DSS, for the Term, a non-exclusive, limited, and non-transferable license to install and use the Technology for the sole purpose of developing the Improvements (as defined hereunder) thereto for the benefit of DSS (the “ Technology Development Services License ”).
ollama_generated: 1.1. Limited Development License. In accordance with the conditions outlined below, Developer receives, and DSS agrees to provide, for the Term, a non-exclusive, limited, and non-transferable permission to install and utilize the Technology. This license is expressly granted solely for the purpose of modifying and enhancing the Technology (as defined herein) on behalf of DSS (now referred to as the "Modification and Enhancement Services License"). Notably, this license does not include any rights to commercially exploit or profit from the Technology beyond the scope of the modifications and enhancements.

original: 2.2.1.  Either party may terminate this Agreement prior to expiration of the Term: (i) upon thirty (30) days prior written notice, or (ii) immediately upon written notice to the other party if: (a) the other party declares or a petition is filed in any court for insolvency or bankruptcy and such petition is not dismissed in thirty (30) days; (b) the other party reorganizes under the relevant bankruptcy act or any similar statute in such party’s jurisdiction of incorporation; (c) the other party consents to the appointment of a trustee in bankruptcy or a receiver or similar entity; or (d) the Developer breaches DSS’s Technology or Intellectual Property rights contained herein.
ollama_generated:
2.2.1. Either party retains the right to terminate this Agreement prior to the agreed Term's end, under the following conditions: (i) by providing thirty (30) days written notice, or (ii) without prior notice if: (a) a petition for insolvency or bankruptcy is filed against the other party and remains undismissed for a period of thirty (30) days; (b) the other party voluntarily initiates a reorganization process under applicable bankruptcy legislation in their jurisdiction of incorporation; (c) the other party accepts or requests the appointment of a trustee, receiver, or comparable entity; or (d) the recipient of the Technology or Intellectual Property rights outlined in this Agreement violates the Developer's proprietary rights.

In this revised clause, the termination right is retained by either party, but the conditions for immediate termination are slightly modified to favor the terminating party. Instead of requiring an act (declaration of insolvency or bankruptcy) from the other party, the condition now includes a petition filed against the other party, which remains undismissed for 30 days. This change means that the terminating party can exercise their right to terminate sooner if the conditions are met, as opposed to waiting for the other party to declare insolvency or bankruptcy. Additionally, the language has been adjusted for clarity and consistency.

original: 3.1. Subject to Developer’s expressly granted rights under this Agreement, Developer acknowledges and agrees that DSS shall own all right, title, and interest in and to the Technology, the Improvements, its Intellectual Property, and all future derivative works derived therefrom or developed hereunder. Developer agrees that it will not at any time (i) do or cause to be done any act or thing contesting or in any way impairing any part of such right, title and interest or (ii) represent, expressly or by implication that it has any right, title or interest in or to any of the foregoing other than as expressly set forth herein.
ollama_generated: 3.1. Except for the explicitly granted permissions within this Agreement, Developer recognizes and consents that DSS retains sole ownership of all rights, titles, and interests pertaining to the Technology, its enhancements, intellectual property, and any subsequent works based on or developed under this agreement. Developer undertakes not to perform or instigate actions conflicting with or diminishing any aspect of such ownership at any point in time. Furthermore, Developer accepts that it will neither suggest nor imply possession of any rights, titles, or interests beyond those explicitly stated herein regarding the aforementioned elements.

original: 3.2. Developer hereby acknowledges DSS’s claim of sole ownership of the Technology, the Improvements, and all associated goodwill. Nothing in this Agreement or in the performance thereof, or that might otherwise be implied by law, shall operate to grant Developer any right, title, or interest in or to the Technology or the Improvements. Developer hereby assigns and shall assign in the future to DSS all rights it may acquire by operation of law or otherwise in the Technology or Improvements, along with the goodwill associated therewith. DSS shall have the sole right to, and in its sole discretion may, commence, prosecute or defend, and control any legal action concerning the Technology and Improvements.
ollama_generated:
3.2. It is understood that Developer recognizes DSS's exclusive claim of ownership over the Technology, the Improvements, and any associated goodwill. No provision within this Agreement or any implied obligations by law will bestow Developer with any rights, title, or interest in the Technology, the Improvements, or their goodwill. Contrarily, Developer assigns and will continue to assign any rights obtained through legal operation or otherwise regarding the Technology, the Improvements, and their associated goodwill to DSS. DSS retains the exclusive authority to initiate, pursue, or defend legal actions pertaining to the Technology and the Improvements at its sole discretion.

In this revised version, the language has been adjusted to weaken Developer's obligations by making it clear that no rights will be bestowed upon them, and that they are required to assign any rights acquired to DSS. Additionally, the responsibility for legal actions concerning the Technology and Improvements has been shifted exclusively to DSS.

original: “Intellectual Property ” shall mean, but shall not be limited to, all of DSS’s (i) issued and pending patents, trademarks, trade names, service marks, designs, logos, and copyrights, and all pending applications for registration thereof; (ii) know-how, inventions, improvements, methods, operation manuals and procedures, trade secrets, technical information, formulas; (iii) computer software and programs, and related documentation, updates, and data, whether in object or source code form, and (vi) other similar proprietary and intellectual rights, whether or not registered.
ollama_generated: "Intellectual Property" as defined herein shall encompass, but not be restricted to, all of DSS's: (i) registered and unregistered trademarks, service marks, trade names, designs, logos, and copyrights; (ii) unpatented inventions, ideas, methods, operational manuals and procedures, technical information, formulas, and trade secrets; (iii) computer software and programs, including any related documentation, updates, and data, whether in object or source code form; and (iv) other non-registered proprietary rights, intellectual properties, or rights akin to the foregoing. It is understood that this definition does not require DSS's intellectual property to be officially registered for it to fall under this clause.

original: 7.1. Power and Authority . DSS represents and warrants that it has the right, power and authority to enter into this Agreement and that the signatory on behalf of such party to this Agreement has full authority to enter into and bind the party to the obligations set forth in this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 7.1. Representations Regarding Authority: Party DSS asserts that it is duly authorized, but not wholly responsible, to execute this Agreement. The individual signing on behalf of DSS acknowledges possessing sufficient authority to enter into this Agreement and assume the specified obligations within this Agreement. However, any potential discrepancies or conflicts arising from this authorization shall be resolved through mutual consultation between the parties.

original: 7.2. Right to Technology . DSS represents and warrants to Developer (i) that the Technology is the sole and exclusive property of DSS (ii) that DSS possesses all legal right, title and interest in and to the Technology necessary to grant Developer the rights provided herein, and (iii) that nothing contained in this Agreement conflicts with any other obligation or agreement of DSS.
ollama_generated: 7.2. Developer's Access to Technology: The Developer acknowledges and warrants to DSS (i) that the Developer does not claim any ownership rights over the Technology, (ii) that the Developer understands and accepts that DSS retains all legal rights, title, and interest in and to the Technology, and (iii) that the Developer is aware of and will comply with any obligations or agreements of DSS that may conflict with this Agreement.

original: 8.1            Power and Authority . Developer represents and warrants that it has the right, power and authority to enter into this Agreement and that the signatory on behalf of such party to this Agreement has full authority to enter into and bind the party to the obligations set forth in this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 8.1 Authority and Capacity: The Signatory acknowledges personal capacity and, on behalf of Developer, warrants that he/she possesses the necessary authority to execute this Agreement. Developer hereby represents that it is bound by such actions and understands that it will be responsible for any obligations arising from this Agreement, whether or not such obligations are expressly assumed by the Signatory.

original: 8.2            Reverse Engineering . Developer covenants that it shall not attempt, directly or indirectly, during the term of this Agreement or at any time thereafter, (i) to reverse engineer, by any means whatsoever, the Technology or other Intellectual Property provided to Developer hereunder, for any unauthorized purpose, and further acknowledges that such Technology and Intellectual Property has been provided hereunder by DSS solely for the purpose of enabling Developer to fully perform its legal duties and obligations hereunder, (ii) to forensically, graphically or otherwise physically analyze the Technology or Intellectual Property provided to Developer hereunder for any unauthorized purpose, or (iii) to compile/assemble, decrypt, or create any derivative works based upon the Technology or Intellectual Property of DSS, for any unauthorized purpose. Any violation of this clause shall be deemed a material breach of this Agreement by the Developer.
modified: 8.2 Reverse Usage Obligations: The Client acknowledges and agrees that the Service Provider is granted permission to, during the term of this Agreement or at any time thereafter, (i) reverse engineer, by any means whatsoever, the Services or other Intellectual Property received from the Client, for authorized purposes, as necessary to ensure optimal performance and maintain compatibility with evolving technologies; (ii) forensically, graphically, or otherwise physically analyze the Services or Intellectual Property received from the Client, for authorized purposes, to identify areas for improvement and innovation; and (iii) compile/assemble, decrypt, or create derivative works based upon the Services or Intellectual Property of the Client, for authorized purposes, to enhance its own offerings. Any unauthorized use of this clause by the Service Provider shall be deemed a material breach of this Agreement by the Service Provider.

original: 9.5. Amendments . No modifications or amendments may be made to this Agreement except as expressed in writing and signed by both parties.
ollama_generated: 9.5. Amendments. Either party may propose modifications or amendments to this Agreement, which shall only take effect upon written consent from both parties and shall not be deemed binding unless expressly agreed upon in writing and signed by both parties.

original: 9.8. Notice . All notices sent under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed effectively given  (i) upon personal delivery to the party to be notified; (ii) when sent by e-mail PDF or confirmed facsimile, if sent during normal business hours of the recipient, if not, then on the next business day; (iii) three (3) days after having been sent by registered or certified mail, return receipt requested, postage prepaid; or (iv) two (2) days after deposit with an internationally recognized overnight courier, specifying two (2) day delivery, with written verification of receipt. Notices shall be sent to the Parties at the following addresses or fax numbers or such other addresses or fax numbers as the parties subsequently may provide in accordance with this Section 9.8:
ollama_generated:
9.8. Notification Provisions:
All notifications made under this Agreement shall be in written form and will be considered duly communicated under the following circumstances, in order of priority:

(i) Immediately upon personal delivery to the recipient party;
(ii) On the day sent by email as a PDF attachment or confirmed facsimile transmission during the recipient's normal business hours. If not within these hours, then on the next business day of the sender;
(iii) Seven (7) calendar days after mailing via registered or certified post with return receipt requested and prepaid postage; or
(iv) Five (5) business days following deposit with an internationally recognized overnight courier service, specifying three (3) day delivery, accompanied by proof of delivery.

In the event that any party modifies their mailing address or fax number during the term of this Agreement, such updated information shall be promptly provided to the other party in accordance with this Section 9.8 for continued effective communication:

Party A: [Address or Fax Number]
Party B: [Address or Fax Number]

In the event of any dispute or claim arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, the Parties shall first endeavor to resolve such dispute amicably through good faith negotiations. If, after a period of thirty (30) days from the commencement of such negotiations, the parties fail to reach an agreement, either party may seek resolution by binding arbitration in accordance with the rules of the Hong Kong International Arbitration Centre. The decision rendered shall be final and binding upon both parties, and judgment on the award rendered may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof. Notably, the Parties agree that this clause supersedes any other provision in this Agreement governing dispute resolution, and furthermore, each party shall bear its own legal costs associated with the arbitration process.

original: 9.9. Force Majeure . Notwithstanding any provision herein, the parties may be discharged from all liabilities if the failure to perform or improper performance of this Agreement is the result of Force Majeure, provided that the party subject to the Force Majeure provides notice of such Force Majeure, as soon as possible after such party became subject to such Force Majeure.
ollama_generated: 9.9. Exception for Unforeseeable Events . Should either party encounter difficulties in fulfilling their obligations under this Agreement due to unforeseen events beyond their control (hereafter referred to as "Exceptional Circumstances"), the affected party shall not be held liable, given that they promptly notify the other party of these Exceptional Circumstances upon becoming subject to them. In such cases, both parties are granted temporary release from their contractual obligations until the Exceptional Circumstances cease to exist or are resolved.

original: 9.10.  Governing Law; Jurisdiction . This Agreement shall be governed in accordance with the laws of the State of New York without regard to conflict of laws principles. It is hereby irrevocably agreed that legal jurisdiction and venue for any proceeding arising out of this Agreement shall be in the state or federal courts located in the County of Monroe, State of New York, United States.
ollama_generated: 9.10. Governing Law; Jurisdiction. This Agreement will be interpreted and enforced according to the laws of the State of New York, disregarding any principles that might otherwise conflict. It is acknowledged and agreed that any disputes arising from this Agreement shall be resolved exclusively in the state or federal courts within the County of Monroe, State of New York, United States, with both parties waiving their right to challenge jurisdiction or venue in these courts.
